title: CRITICAL: .env with real GitLab token committed to repository
description: The .env file contains a real GitLab Personal Access Token (glpat-...) and is tracked in git (.gitignore only excludes /target). This token is exposed in repository history. Fix: 1) Add .env to .gitignore, 2) Remove .env from tracking, 3) User must rotate the token on GitLab.
close_reason: Removed .env from tracking, added to .gitignore, created .env.example

title: Test Coverage — achieve ≥80% and add UI + pagination tests
description: Current test suite has 37 tests covering client, conductor, and model layers. Missing: UI rendering tests, pagination edge cases (>100 runners spanning multiple pages), and overall coverage measurement. Goal is ≥80% line coverage.
acceptance_criteria:
DONE WHEN ALL OF THE FOLLOWING ARE TRUE:
1. cargo-tarpaulin or cargo-llvm-cov is configured and produces a coverage report
2. Overall line coverage is ≥80% as reported by the coverage tool
3. At least 2 UI rendering tests exist: one verifying render_command_selection produces expected widget output, one verifying render_results renders a table with the correct number of rows
4. At least 2 pagination edge case tests exist in conductor: one with exactly 100 runners (boundary — should fetch page 2), one with 101 runners (verifies page 2 fetch and concatenation)
5. All existing tests continue to pass
6. Coverage report generation is documented in README.md Development section (e.g. 'cargo tarpaulin --out html')
7. cargo test passes, cargo clippy clean

title: Streaming Pagination — display first page immediately
description: Currently the UI blocks with a spinner until ALL pages are fetched and enriched. For large fleets (>100 runners), this can take many seconds. Display the first page of results immediately while continuing to load and enrich subsequent pages in the background.
design: Split conductor.fetch_runners into a streaming approach: return a channel or use a shared Vec behind Arc+Mutex. The TUI renders whatever data is available on each tick. Add a 'Loading more...' indicator in the status bar while background fetching continues. Consider using tokio::spawn for the background pagination loop.
acceptance_criteria:
DONE WHEN ALL OF THE FOLLOWING ARE TRUE:
1. After the first API page returns, the results table is visible and navigable — the user does NOT see a spinner for the full duration
2. Subsequent pages load in the background and rows appear incrementally in the table
3. A visual indicator (e.g. 'Loading more... (page 2/N)' or a subtle status bar message) is shown while background loading is active
4. The indicator disappears when all pages are loaded
5. User can navigate (j/k/Up/Down) the partial results while loading continues
6. If the user presses Esc during loading, loading stops and partial results are discarded cleanly (no leaked tasks)
7. Error on page N>1 shows a warning but keeps pages 1..N-1 results visible
8. At least 2 tests: one verifying partial results are accessible, one verifying cancellation cleans up
9. cargo test passes, cargo clippy clean

title: PERF: N+1 API calls for manager fetches - parallelize with futures

acceptance_criteria: Manager fetches are parallelized. Test verifies concurrent requests complete correctly.

title: BUG: Runners still may not display tags — fetch_runner_detail enrichment needs diagnosis
description:
The GitLab `/runners/all` list endpoint does NOT return `tag_list`, `version`, or `revision` in its response body (confirmed via official GitLab 18.4 API docs). We added `fetch_runner_detail` enrichment to call `GET /runners/:id` for each runner, which DOES return these fields. However, the enrichment uses `unwrap_or(r)` — if detail fetch fails silently (permissions, rate limits, timeout), tags remain empty.

Root cause analysis needed:
1. Verify `fetch_runner_detail` actually succeeds against real GitLab (may need `admin` scope for `/runners/:id`)
2. The mock tests use response bodies that include `tag_list` in the list endpoint — this doesn't reflect real API behavior
3. No logging/tracing when detail enrichment fails — failures are swallowed silently
4. No concurrency limit on parallel detail fetches — may hit API rate limits causing silent failures

Additionally, the `tag_list[]` query parameter format may be wrong. GitLab docs show `tag_list` as a "string array" param but don't specify the exact encoding. It may need `tag_list=tag1,tag2` instead of `tag_list[]=tag1&tag_list[]=tag2`.
acceptance_criteria:
- Add tracing::warn when fetch_runner_detail fails so failures are visible in logs
- Add a concurrency limit (e.g., 10) to parallel detail fetches via futures::stream::buffer_unordered
- Verify tag_list query param encoding matches GitLab API expectations
- Update mock test response bodies to match real /runners/all response (no tag_list, no version)
- Add integration-style test that verifies enrichment pipeline: list → detail → merge
close_reason: Implemented: added tracing::warn on detail/manager failures, buffer_unordered(10) concurrency limit, error_for_status on managers, fixed mock fidelity, added conductor tests

title: BUG: Missing /api/v4/ prefix in all API endpoint URLs
description: GitLabClient.request() builds URLs like https://gitlab.com/runners/all instead of https://gitlab.com/api/v4/runners/all. The /api/v4/ prefix is missing, causing all API calls to 404 on real GitLab instances. Affects fetch_runners and fetch_runner_managers. Fix: prepend /api/v4/ to the URL construction in the request() method. Update tests accordingly.
acceptance_criteria: All API requests include /api/v4/ prefix. Existing mock tests updated to match new URL paths. New test verifying URL construction.
close_reason: Added /api/v4/ prefix to all API URLs, updated all mock tests
